title: How to write patent claims - Quora

response.answer_text: Claims are the most important part of the patent application. Claims decide the scope of the invention and what exactly the inventor will receive as protection. Claims are broadly of two types: One part claim and two part claim. Both One part and Two part claims describe the independent claim however two part claim use the term “characterised in that” in the independent claim where the text after characterised in that is considered as the actual invention which inventor seeks protection on. One part claim is used for US patents and Two part claim is used for EP patents. Also, in India two part claim is preferred. Claims have Independent claim and dependent claims. Independent claim covers the most essential part of invention without which the invention won't function. Dependent claims cover additional features of the invention. To write claims, one should get hold of key features of the invention. Out of the key features select, most essential features that will go in independent claim and rest in dependent claims. Different people follow different startegy for claims. Some prefer claiming the entire system in one independent claim and the entire method/process in another independent claim. Some prefer claiming invention from device perspective such as host device, receiving device. Refer to some granted patents of the jurisdiction you plan to file a patent in, to get hold of certain patent related terms. Further, makes sure the claims clearly convey 1. Inventive step 2. Novelty 3. Industrial application, as these three are essential for patent grant. Keep practicing to get good at drafting claims. Get in touch if you face any troubles. Let me know if you have more queries. Hi there, I am an IPR (Intellectual Property Rights) intern, In CSIR Innovation Protection Unit. For Starter, you can go and search alike patents like your invention on google patents (Google Patents) it covers mostly US & Chinese patents. In compete specification you can see how the claims have been drafted. It will help you a lot, because the language which is usually used in drafting is very peculiar. There are some point you have to keep in mind while writing(drafting) claims: Claim 1 is you main claim , it should contain the crisp of your invention.All the subsequent claims should look like they depend (or linked to) on main claim, else in First Examination Report (FER), they (Indian Patent Office) can raise an objection.Each claim should end with a full stop(not between it), even if it divided in parts like a,b,c… etc.For example: From Indian Patent related to Internet of Things” (from Indian Patent Advanced Search System ::I(/We) claim,1. A system which will help us providing real-time data of distance of the hurdle from the sensor, said system comprising:-	An ultrasonic sensor embedded to the Programmable Logic Controller (PLC)-	Connectivity module embedded to PLC to send and receive data to and from the server on Transport layer of OSI model-	USB port (also known as USB connector) to burn program code into the Programmable Logic Controller-	Solar-panel as per different industrial application-	Set of (or single) rechargable batteries attached to the said system to recharge in daylight and provide power supply in night-	External power supply port in case of requirement of an external power-	LED light(s)-	A durable material box to cover the system2.	A system as claimed in claim 1 wherein, PLC embedded with connectivity module (like WiFi module or/and GSM module or/and Iradium transceiver)3.	A system as claimed in claim 1 wherein, ultrasonic sensor is any device working on principal of ultrasonic echo of measuring time between sending and receiving signal4.	A system as claimed in claim 1 wherein, the USB Port (also known as USB Connector) can be USB 2.0 and any other USB version above USB 2.05.	A system as claimed in claim 1 wherein, solar panel is of any type (including solar shringles) or/and of any size or/and of any voltage output is used6.	A system as claimed in claim 1 wherein, the external power supply is a power connector to provide input of any voltage or/and any ampere7.	A system as claimed in claim 1 will be covered or wrapped or protected in a durable material box to sustain extreme weather.3Happy to Help :)
